casebody.data:
ANDREW BRENGEL, MARY BAKER AND ELIZABETH BRENGEL, RELATORS, v. THE MAYOR AND ALDERMEN OF JERSEY CITY, BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF JERSEY CITY AND EDWARD J. SPOERER, SUPERINTENDENT OF DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS OF JERSEY CITY, RESPONDENTS. Submitted October term, 1930 Decided June 24, 1931.

Before G-ummebe, Chief Justice, and Justices Tbenohabd and Lloyd.

Por the relators, Ziegener & Brenner (Robert II. Brenner, of counsel). For the respondents, Thomas J. Brogan and Charles IIershenstein. Pee Cueiam.

The questions involved in this case are the same as those considered and passed upon in Holdsworth v. Hague et ah (No. 56 of the present term), and for the reasons there expressed a peremptory writ of mandamus is awarded.
